text: A black-and-white photograph of a wide, cobblestone market square at dawn or dusk. In the foreground, several pigeons dot the uneven stones, their dark silhouettes casting long shadows. Mid-scene, a small crowd of people walks toward the bright horizon, where the low sun glows just above the rooftops. On the right, the tower of a church rises sharply into a sky streaked with dramatic, textured clouds; a few birds circle overhead. To the left and right, the tall façades of historic buildings frame the square in near-silhouette. (Original photo – view of the church from the side of the “Adaś” statue.)

Black-and-white photograph of a cobblestone city square at sunset. In the foreground, several pigeons peck and stand on the wet stones. Beyond them, a group of people is silhouetted against the low sun, which gleams through a row of historic buildings. To the right, a church tower rises above the skyline; to the left, the dark outlines of other buildings frame the square. A flock of birds is frozen in flight against a sky streaked with clouds. Along the far right edge of the image, vertical bands of brightly colored pixel blocks and glitch artifacts reveal damage in the restored graphic file.

A black-and-white photograph of a single strawberry resting on a smooth, reflective surface. The berry is covered in tiny water droplets, its seeds and textured skin sharply in focus. Its leafy calyx points upward. In the softly blurred background you can just make out indistinct shapes—a desk or countertop, a potted plant, and vague office-like elements. (Caption from context: “Owoc przed transportem w czasie” – “Fruit before time transport.”)

The image is a black-and-white photograph of a single strawberry, calyx (green leaves and stem) still attached. One side of the berry is unusually smooth and largely devoid of its tiny surface seeds—presumably scraped off during transport. The strawberry sits alone on a shiny, reflective tabletop (or metal surface), its soft shadow mirrored beneath it. In the background, out of focus, you can just make out a plastic container and indistinct shapes, lending a sense of a kitchen or processing area. Context caption (in Polish): “Owoc pozbawiony pestek po transporcie” (“Fruit stripped of seeds after transport”).

The image shows a monochrome 3D rendering of a hybrid fruit that combines features of a strawberry and a cherry. It has the plump, heart-shaped body and characteristic pitted surface of a strawberry, but on top sprouts a single, slender cherry stem with two small leaves. The overall effect is a glossy, surreal “fusion” of the two fruits.

A round plate holding seven triangular slices of pizza topped with pineapple chunks, arranged in a loose circle. Scattered crumbs and small charred bits cling to the crusts and the plate’s rim. The dough appears freshly baked—still warm and crispy—and one slice remains only partially eaten. These leftovers were found near the temporal chamber.

No i co teraz? No, to teraz mi już nie powstrzymać. Jesteśmy tutaj sami i czuła tylko wykonać plan. Ja się tego wzmieszczę. Zmien, dobrze wyzaponowałem powywnia. A do miała racja. Jedna informacja, ponieważ na w czasie jedna informacja. Dwa lata wcześniej posunię całe badania do przodu i wtedy już będzie z górki. Muzefki na odwagę. Zróbka, komułowanie wyfło. Ale rany was ludźmin, co czy? No, rany jedna myfa, mowa to nie wywoła. Ale, ale, ale, Adam mówi, że to jest stabilne. Wytosie, to uda. Czyła tylko co w nocie w czasie. I jeden, jeden raz. Do grudziąca. Znaleźć hotel i nam mogli być hoteli w grudziącą. I ja nie wiem, ale na pewno znajdę jeden. I potem czekać spokojnie, czekać dwa lata. Znaleźć to, co? No to siłpe. Wpisujemy. Czekaj nie prze. Kordnaty. Są grudziąc. Dobra. Patman nie wchodzi. A jest w menu człowiek. Dobra. Znaleźć tych grik. Znaleźć to, co? Znaleźć to, co? Dobra. Dobra. Jestem gotowy. Jeszcze jedno na odwagę. Tak znaczy się to by nie wfednie. Dobra. Naciwamy. Czekamy. To liczcie. I ile mogę czekać? Dobra. Jestem gotowy. To biorą. Ciero.
